page.title: 04CLASTON FARM
page.content: { Claston Farm,}with its farmhouse dating from 1740, is 500 acres in area, and is owned by Mr.Davis. He grows{hops, cider fruits, cereal {crops,}and breeds{Fresian cattle}which are sent to the slaughter house at 1 year old for beef. Great precautions are taken against diseases such as foot & mouth. The farmer has many acres of cereal & fruit. He has 56 acres of winter wheat, 112 acres of winter barley, 6 acres of spring barley, 117 acres of peas and 141 acres of grass. The fruit is rotated every year in the 10 orchards of the farm. Apples such as "Brown Snout" and "Dobinette" are grown. There is also 100 acres of hops. Some produce is sold to{Bulmers.
